radiographic_examinations.findings: Small right and trace left pleural effusion; mild cardiomegaly is stable; segmental peripheral subcentimeter cystic lesions in the right liver periphery predominantly involve the subcapsular portion of segment VIII, slightly more prominent since a previous exam; no evidence of rim enhancement or drainable fluid collection; abdominal drainage catheters noted; post-surgical changes observed including stranding adjacent to the splenic flexure; scattered subcentimeter renal hypodensities likely represent cysts; unremarkable loops of large and small bowel; no pneumatosis, free air, or obstruction.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Segmental peripheral subcentimeter cystic lesions in the right liver periphery are slightly more prominent since a previous exam.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Rectum, sigmoid, prostate, and seminal vesicles are unremarkable; small left greater than right fat-containing inguinal hernias; no lesion concerning for metastasis or infection seen on bone windows.
